sourcing.instructions: Co (Cobalt powder) - Specialty chemical suppliers; Ga (Gallium metal) - Electronics suppliers; P (Phosphorus powder) - Chemical suppliers; Tb (Terbium metal) - Rare earth suppliers; Y (Yttrium metal) - Metal suppliers.
steps: Co (Cobalt powder) - Specialty chemical suppliers; Ga (Gallium metal) - Electronics suppliers; P (Phosphorus powder) - Chemical suppliers; Tb (Terbium metal) - Rare earth suppliers; Y (Yttrium metal) - Metal suppliers.

1. Weigh out 120 g of cobalt powder and place it in a clean mixing container. 2. Add 30 g of gallium metal to the cobalt powder. 3. Gradually introduce 10 g of phosphorus powder while stirring to ensure even distribution. 4. Add 10 g of terbium metal and 10 g of yttrium metal, continuing to stir thoroughly. 5. Ensure the mixture is homogeneous.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 120 g of cobalt powder and place it in a clean mixing container. 2. Add 30 g of gallium metal to the cobalt powder. 3. Gradually introduce 10 g of phosphorus powder while stirring to ensure even distribution. 4. Add 10 g of terbium metal and 10 g of yttrium metal, continuing to stir thoroughly. 5. Ensure the mixture is homogeneous.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixture into a crucible suitable for high temperatures. 2. Heat the crucible in a furnace to a temperature of 900°C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and mixing of the components.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixture into a crucible suitable for high temperatures. 2. Heat the crucible in a furnace to a temperature of 900°C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and mixing of the components.

steps: 1. Remove the crucible from the furnace carefully using heat-resistant gloves. 2. Allow the crucible to cool to room temperature naturally for approximately 4 hours, avoiding any rapid temperature changes.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Remove the crucible from the furnace carefully using heat-resistant gloves. 2. Allow the crucible to cool to room temperature naturally for approximately 4 hours, avoiding any rapid temperature changes.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Use a grinding tool to sand the edges and surfaces to achieve a smooth finish. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant to protect the surface from oxidation, allowing it to cure as per the manufacturer's instructions.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Use a grinding tool to sand the edges and surfaces to achieve a smooth finish. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant to protect the surface from oxidation, allowing it to cure as per the manufacturer's instructions.
